alert.note: Alert for Oklahoma (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 11 at 8:58AM CDT until July 12 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Norman has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Oklahoma... North Canadian River at Oklahoma City at Britton Road affecting Oklahoma County. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...North Canadian River at Oklahoma City at Britton Road. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Low-lying croplands and pastures east of Oklahoma City near the towns of Spencer and Jones may be briefly flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CDT Tuesday the stage was 13.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 16.0 feet. - Forecast...The North Canadian River is expected to rise to a crest of 16.0 feet this afternoon. - Action stage is 16.0 feet. - Flood stage is 17.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you encounter a flooded roadway, turn around and find an alternative route. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this evening at 900 PM CDT.
